item.title: Linux Process
item.description: Process Creation A process is a running instance of a program, or in other words, representation of a program when executing by the processor. A program is a file that contains machine code, which can be understood and executed by a processor. It is obtained from code written in some programming language and undergoes a transformation to become machine code and thus a program. Here is an example of code written in C programming language: #include <stdio.
